citation.article-title: ‘Candidatus Helicobacter suis’, a gastric helicobacter from pigs, and its phylogenetic relatedness to other gastrospirilla

p.s: Description of Candidatus Helicobacter suis sp. nov.

Candidatus Helicobacter suis (name G. suis was proposed (Mendes et al., 1990), as these bacteria were morphologically similar to Gastrospirillum hominis, a un-culturable bacterium seen in human gastric biopsy specimens (McNulty et al., 1989))

The description is as follows: Candidatus Helicobacter suis [(ε-Proteobacteria), genus Helicobacter; porcine isolates have been propagated in mice, but not in vitro; Gram-negative; Helical; NAS (GenBank accession no. AF127028), oligonucleotide sequence complementary to unique region of 16S rRNA gene 5'-AGCCGCGAGGCAGAGCTAATC-3’; morphology, 2.5-3.5 x 0.6 μm, multiple complete spiral turns with a wavelength of ~ 600 nm, multiple bipolar flagella; symbiotic (Sus, stomach); strong urease activity, cross-reaction with polyclonal H. pylori-derived antibodies].
